title: Quick start 101 seems to need additional dependency
body:
## üêõ Bug Report
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. --> 
Following the Quick Start causes an error as written.  In step 2-
```from catalyst import dl, utils``` causes a module not found error.


### How To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. ```pip install  catalyst``` - I use miniconda and already have pytorch installed (v 1.11.0)
2.  In a jupyter notebook 
```
import os
from torch import nn, optim
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader
from catalyst import dl, utils
```

### Expected behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Import with no errors or please explain in Quick Start 101 what dependencies are needed - is `tensorboard` needed?


<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well --> 

### Error Message
```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
Input In [540], in <cell line: 4>()
      2 from torch import nn, optim
      3 from torch.utils.data import DataLoader
----> 4 from catalyst import dl, utils

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/catalyst/dl/__init__.py:3, in <module>
      1 # flake8: noqa
----> 3 from catalyst.core import *
      4 from catalyst.engines import *
      5 from catalyst.loggers import *

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/catalyst/core/__init__.py:8, in <module>
      1 # flake8: noqa
      2 # import order:
      3 # engine
      4 # runner
      5 # callback
      6 # logger
----> 8 from catalyst.core.engine import Engine
      9 from catalyst.core.runner import IRunner, IRunnerError
     10 from catalyst.core.callback import (
     11     ICallback,
     12     Callback,
   (...)
     18     CallbackWrapper,
     19 )

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/catalyst/core/engine.py:7, in <module>
      3 from typing import Callable, Dict
      5 import numpy as np
----> 7 from accelerate import Accelerator
      8 from accelerate.state import DistributedType
      9 import torch

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/accelerate/__init__.py:7, in <module>
      1 # flake8: noqa
      2 # There's no way to ignore "F401 '...' imported but unused" warnings in this
      3 # module, but to preserve other warnings. So, don't check this module at all.
      5 __version__ = "0.9.0"
----> 7 from .accelerator import Accelerator
      8 from .big_modeling import cpu_offload, disk_offload, dispatch_model, init_empty_weights, load_checkpoint_and_dispatch
      9 from .launchers import debug_launcher, notebook_launcher

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/accelerate/accelerator.py:32, in <module>
     30 from .scheduler import AcceleratedScheduler
     31 from .state import AcceleratorState
---> 32 from .tracking import LOGGER_TYPE_TO_CLASS, GeneralTracker, filter_trackers
     33 from .utils import (
     34     DeepSpeedPlugin,
     35     DistributedDataParallelKwargs,
   (...)
     52     wait_for_everyone,
     53 )
     56 if is_deepspeed_available():

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/accelerate/tracking.py:29, in <module>
     26 _available_trackers = []
     28 if is_tensorboard_available():
---> 29     from torch.utils import tensorboard
     31     _available_trackers.append(LoggerType.TENSORBOARD)
     33 if is_wandb_available():

File /media/SSD/conda_env/gi-tract/lib/python3.10/site-packages/torch/utils/tensorboard/__init__.py:1, in <module>
----> 1 import tensorboard
      2 from distutils.version import LooseVersion
      4 if not hasattr(tensorboard, '__version__') or LooseVersion(tensorboard.__version__) < LooseVersion('1.15'):

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorboard'

```
